Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: newtonmum
Reviews.Content: This downtown hotel right next to McGill University is close to everything, St Catherine, Museum of Art (free but opens late at 11am), Parc Royal. If you want your stay to be within walking distances of all of that, this is the hotel for you. Valet parking at $25 a night is standard for city hotels. Free wifi is a plus. Cleaning service is so so. It's a no frill hotel. We asked for a higher floor room and got 12th. Not noisy but the heating is very old so even if it's turned off, the room is still unbearably warm. Rooms could use a facelift. I noticed a lot of business travelers there too.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, Wi-Fi not so great”
Reviews.Author: Dee S
Reviews.Content: Location, fantastic. Room, simple but nice. Wi-fi, useless. Hot water situation at night, iffy. I would have graded this hotel as good between average and very good if that was a rating option. If you are in Montreal for shopping, concert, or sightseeing, this is an affordable option. Not for business traveller because I was unable to do any work with the Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the centre of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: dreimann2408
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the city of Montreal directly below the Mont Royal. We stayed for two nights at the beginning of April 2012. We arrived by taxi directly from the Montreal airport and the service at the reception desk was very friendly. Our room was a king size bed room located at the 10th floor. The room was quite and on the backside of the hotel. The cleanness was okay but could be better. Some old hairs in the bathroom as well as old carpet and old curtain have shown the age of the hotel. So in total the hotel is an old hotel what could and should be updated in the next year(s). What we really can recommend its the location of the hotel. You can do all downtown sightseeings without a car. The hotel is so well located that all interesting points are in a walking distance. So we would recommend the hotel for a short stay in the centre of Montreal if you don't expect a 4**** or 5***** service. The hotel offers a good 3*** standard.

Reviews.Title: “Situated close to all the action, not quiet”
Reviews.Author: Beach-tastic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for people who are in Montreal to have fun and go out to bars because it is located downtown, not too far from the action. If you're looking for a quiet hotel for a weekend, I do not recommend you stay here because this is where people stay when they come to party in Montreal. There's noise in the halls around 11pm before the partyers go out and then more noise again when they get back at around 4-5am. The hotel is decent, very well kept. It obviously does not have higher quality finishes and the rooms are a bit dated. Good value hotel if you don't plan on sleeping much.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Ville Marie”
Reviews.Author: Paulo S
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Excelent and warm reception, good vallet parking and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: 19eggs53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two teenagers stayed at this hotel for a weekend. It was our first time at this hotel and believe me it will not be our last. Our room was large with two double beds that were really comfortable. The bathroom was quite large. Everything in our room and the hotel in general was very clean, neat and tidy. It has a main restaurant, a bar and a small cafe. It has valet parking with a rate comparable to local public parking sites. It is within easy walking distance of many good restaurants and shopping. Front desk and other staff that we met were very professional, friendly and helpful. When we checked out Sunday, there was a restuarant charge on the room invoice that we felt was not ours. Front desk staff took down my home phone number and promised to look into it on Monday. On Tuesday, I received a call from Remi at the hotel confirming the additional charge was not ours and that it had since been removed from credit card account. On our next visit to Montreal we will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mary D. The only place to stay in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent service, excellent accommodation. Rami is amazing. He wil make you feel like you are the only guest. There is no reason to stay anywhere else in Montreal. And the coffee in the coffee shop truly must be the best in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service, Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Beth H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel three times in the last two years, and I must say, our stay is always been enjoyable. The rooms are beautiful and clean, the location is so convenient, but to top it off, Rami, is an amazing person and employee at the hotel. He always goes over and above to accommodate and make sure you are pleased with your stay. Very nice man that is always willing to help and make your stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “To be recommended, with Mangala Ghaleb as the Star Performer”
Reviews.Author: knutlabo
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Montreal and a bull's eye both regarding the city and our hotel! Very centrally located, within walking distance of most sights both downtown and a small climb up the hill of Le Mont Royal, choices of a light meal in the cafe or more exclusive meals in the restaurant, reasonably priced in this part of town. Spacious room, with the best hotel beds ever - had to force ourselves of bed every morning to explore the city. Excellent staff support in all matters, warm-hearted, loving and all-embracing Maitre d'hotel, Mangala Ghaleb in the restaurant being the star performer, making us feel very special guests in town, in the province of Quebec and on the continent of North America. Anna (Iceland) and Knut Lage (Norway).

Reviews.Title: “A great stay.”
Reviews.Author: RomanticTravels
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Best Western Ville Marie two times now on business and I must say that the staff have been wonderful and very accommodating. They have made my stays with them very comfortable. I highly recommend staying here. There is plenty of shopping a few minutes walk and amazing restaurants. Rooms are spacious and very clean. For the price, this place is a MUST stay when you travel to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Awesome Location! Love it!”
Reviews.Author: RatTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to montreal and staying at the Best Western. The manager Sam is wonderful!!! He is so sweet and accommodating to me and my friends. The staff has always been so helpful and friendly. The location is great, close to shopping, hiking on Mount Royale and subways. The rooms are very clean and the beds are soooo comfortable. ahhh! Can't wait to come back to Montreal - thanks Best Western!! hugs... PAM!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Justin1963
Reviews.Content: I travelled to montreal on a business trip for 2 days and stayed at the Best western ville marie for 2 days on January 28-29. A very pleasant stay. I was impressed by the awesome attitude of the staff there, always smiling and at your service. Great location in the heart of downtown. Can be a bit noisey at night.. but hey, its downtown! Room was very clean and bed was comfortable. Definitely a positive experience! I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lost25
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located next to McGill in the city center, very convenient and easily access to many nice restaurants and shopping malls. Love the coffee shop downstairs of the hotel, best croissant and coffee! Room in the hotel is spacious but need some work, the carpet smells, furnitures need some urgent update... Then we compromised for the location of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Attention From Manager”
Reviews.Author: earl s
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in May 2011 and again in Dec 2011. A high standard of excellence was experienced during both visits and great value was received for the amenities provided. An example of the prompt friendly service occured with a problem with the entry system, repaired within the hour. Special thanks to the Manager who assisted me in obtaining boarding passes on both visits and was warmly courteous to my visiting daughter and grandson.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: Best food, waiters and waitresses in a restaurant ever. Very attentive. Good room. Security personnel a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: happercamper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Best Western Ville Marie in November 2011 for 5 nights & at the end of December 2011 for 2 nights. This is a great, cost effective hotel in a central location close to downtown shopping, the subway, good restaurants, etc. What makes BW Ville Marie so special is the wonderful front desk staff. They take pride in their jobs & greeted me like I was being welcomed into their own homes. Thank you Rami & Richard especially, for caring for the people that you serve. So much appreciated! Not all front desk staff in other hotels have your great attitude. ( I am an outside sales rep & was inspired by how all of the front desk staff at BW Ville Marie treat their customers. In fact, I gleaned insight from them on how to better serve my own customers) The rooms are clean & have everything I need, to make my stay, (business or pleasure, comfortable. On my trip to BW Ville Marie in December, Rami upgraded my room at check-in. I didn't ask for this, but was wonderfully suprised at his kindness & professional customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff !!! Great location. !!!”
Reviews.Author: Guy C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on many occasions and found the staff to be very professional , helpful and pleasant. Hotel is well located and close to shops,restaurants and metro stations. Would recommend it to anyone wanting to be dowtown for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Eric0383
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Ville Marie for 2 nights couple weeks ago. I was very impressed by the great attitude of the staff from the minute I stepped in until the moment I checked out. The room was very clean ,and the location of the hotel is great! (in the middle of downtown, walking distance from many stores, witch made my early christmas shopping very easy!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: olga k
Reviews.Content: Returned from Montreal a couple of days ago and still under the impression of the wonderful staff working at the hotel. I travel a lot in the USA and Canada and have stayed at different "Best Western" hotels. Some of them may be better furnished or have a swimming pool like the "Best Western" in downtown Quebec City but I was really impressed by an absolutely impeccable TOTALLY bilingual staff. I speak only English and sometimes it was a problem for me to understand people working at the reception at Quebec hotel or at "Best Western Europa" also located in Montreal, apart from the other problems I came across at the above hotels. As for the location - it could not be better as it is in the very core of downtown Montreal walking distance to the best shopping and major museums. That is why you can close your eyes on not so modern furniture or interior. By the way, the rooms are clean and the beds are rather comfortable. If I am ever in Montreal again, I'll certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right in the middle of downtown Montreal. Unfortunately that's the only good thing about it. The rooms are furnished with outdated, drab furniture, and in my room, the lamp needed to be repaired because the button to turn it on had fallen off. I also found signs of bed bugs in my bed during the first night there, and later found bed bugs in my luggage. I would not recomend this hotel. Many hotels have bed bugs, but most of them are a lot cheaper. Save your money and get bed bug bites at a cleaner, better equipped hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very honest staff”
Reviews.Author: kkn_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Ville Marie in Montreal for 2 nights in October 2011. The room was spacious and clean. The location is unbeatable with easy and walkable access to Downtown Montreal! My most memorable experience was when the Manager handed me my wallet (everything in it was intact!) which was left at the lobby washroom by mistake! The staff at the hotel is very honest and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean and LOADS of hot water and pressure !”
Reviews.Author: Lucie R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Best Western Ville-Marie in Montreal and had a perfect experience. Friendly and VERY professional and helpful staff, very clean room, full-comfort mattress (not to mention that the bed wasn't sky-high, just at the right height, like a normal house bed, which I really appreciated), the water-pressure was strong and regular and there was plenty of hot hot water ! The location is very convenient and...the windows open and let the fresh air come in if you want (which I do, I like to have fresh air in a hotel room). The room was very clean, so were the linnens and the bathroom. I tried the room service and both food and staff were excellent. A definitively excellent price/quality rapport. I'll go back !

Reviews.Title: “Very good lodging option in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ucanonico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Western Ville Marie in November 2011 for 3 nights in our first visit to Montreal. The reception personnel service is great. The rooms and the hotel as a whole look quite old, kind of 60s or 70s, but everything works fine. Our room was quite clean and the bed very comfortable. The only negative is that walls are too thin, you can hear what happens in the hall and adjacent rooms. The location is superb, just one block north of Peel station on the green line, a couple of blocks north of one tourist information office, right beside McGill university campus and 2-3 blocks south of Mont Royal. The have parking service, but we did not make use of it. I would only recommend to hotel managers to invest some money in renewing a bit the hotel appearance and sound-proofing the rooms. Including a continental breakfast in the current rate would be a nice addition. For us this hotel was a nice experience and a nice value for money (we paid around $85, including a discount for timely booking and prepay) and would likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: nicole g
Reviews.Content: I stayed this past weekend and no regret.Room given to us was large and very clean.I`ve seen other hotel and by far whatever bad rap they say I donot believe it.Just unhappy people...

Reviews.Title: “great staff,great room”
Reviews.Author: joseph n
Reviews.Content: great stay,impeccable rooms,need updating because furnitures are worn out on edges,had good night sleep,bed is very comportable.`staffs were all friendly...felt like home

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: irishwaterspaniel
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on a tour. Friendly staff and a comfortable room with a fridge, very useful and something I did not find very often during the holiday. Good location for walking around town. Only real downside was that the hotel could do with updating.

Reviews.Title: “An Unexpected Gem”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and was tiring of the excessive charges and surcharges of the premium chain hotels. Searching for hotels in Montreal, I discovered the Best Western Ville-Marie and saw that it received good ratings and decided to give it a shot. It's in the heart of the Montreal business district, and easily accessible to offices, shopping, and so on. Boy, was I impressed! The hotel was very clean and modern, and the staff delightfully attentative and responsive. The beds were a definite step up in quality and comfort over others in this class, and the heating and ventilation systems were quite (a big problem for me). The best surprise for me was the Lebanese restaurant, which surprised me at a BW. It was recommended that I try the fillet mignon shish-kababs, and they were succulent. The wine list featured a Lebanese choices as well, that accented the meal nicely. This hotel definitely hits the mark for business-oriented travelers who need good value but appreciate a fine experience. I was delighted and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Jag
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel but has everything you need for a good price in a good location. Service has been good also. Montreal is lovely !

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update”
Reviews.Author: ProspectGeoff
Reviews.Content: Part of a tour of Canada: This hotel is in a good position and serves its function, but it really is shabby and needs a complete decoration. Staff are friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: cint044
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located close to shopping and restaurants. Yes this hotel is old and definitely requires updating. The rooms are clean and the bed comfortable. The water pipes do rumble. If you are spending all your time in the room I wouldn't recommend it. The staff at the front desk are the friendliest I have encountered on this trip. If you get the pleasure of staying here I hope you are checked in by Peter.

Reviews.Title: “if you find a good price, it's ok”
Reviews.Author: rosellinarossa
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel just one night. I was disappointed for the price paid. We get a double room for 180 dollars: I have a corporate code that could be used also for leasure travel, and when i entered the hotel asking if they had one room and giving my corporate code, they said that the corporate code cannot be used, but they could give me a 10% discount. Later I found out that the same room in their internet site, using the corporate code costs just 120 dollars. I wrote to the hotel, but they just said that the price change every moment. That's why i will avoid this chain if I could find another one. anyway, the hotel is in a good location, near to dorchester sqare, even if in my opinion it's not really central. the rooms have Free wifi, empty fridge, coffe makar, no satefy bx, and the double queen room are very big, even if a bit outdated, but anyway very clean. being dated, the acustics is not very good, you could find people in the next room! the Parking is expensive, (35 dollars) but if you are in the city during the weekend you could park in the street without paying anything. the hotel, even if is outdated is nice, well mantained, but I feel the price I've paid is too much for what i've got! in the lobby there are 2 pc and printers for the customers. gymn. if you could find a good price, the hotel is nice, but if you pay what i paid, there is for sure nicer hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, professional people ...”
Reviews.Author: traveldevil1
Reviews.Content: I am a tour guide and I am coming to this hotel for years with my German tourists. We always appreciate the real nice and warm reception we receive by all staff members. They are very accommodating and helpful in any way. The breakfast and dinner are tasteful and in a nice athmosphere. The rooms are not the newest ones but they are always clean and well done. Location is what counts in Montreal - we can walk anywhere since we are in the middle of the city close to all the interesting parts as well as shopping and restaurants. It is always a pleasure to stay at the BW Ville Marie!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: tomden
Reviews.Content: I liked many things about the place; it was walking distance to every place I had to go, and close to many good restaurants. Speaking of restaurant the one in the hotel has a great menu and the food and service were awesome. A few things to mention, the building is kind of old and although there was apparent renovations throughout the years the multiple coats of paint on the door frames says that new renovations are needed. My biggest issue was the ridiculous step to the bathroom for which there was a definite attempt to smooth out but I still banged my toes on it. Only valet parking service is available for a charge but the service is very good, I didn't have to wait for my car when I needed it. All of the elevators were renovated and probably not too long ago. Some of them are pretty small but they take you where you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and safe!”
Reviews.Author: scotiangirl194
Reviews.Content: First thing that you need to know is that they valet park your car for 25.00. Check-in staff were pleasant and friendly. The room was on the tenth floor and was spacious and clean but a bit dated. There was an old-style t.v., mini fridge, coffee maker, and large mirrored closets. The bathroom was large and clean but does need updating. The room had dark carpeting so it looked clean but my son's white socks told another story. The two queen beds were so comfortable and clean, had the best nights sleep ever on our five day road trip. It was fun to stay right in the city, and on the suggestion of Phillip (one of the valet guys) we walked to Crescent street to take in the sights and see all of the restaurants there. The hotel has a restaurant, and a cafe. We had coffee in the cafe and watched people on the street. I really liked this hotel and we would come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor service”
Reviews.Author: snapsean
Reviews.Content: We pre booked through expedia for 3 rooms. We were very tired, and this was the last night of a 3 week family road trip. Upon checking in, we were told only one room was booked. My Online printout clearly showed 3 rooms. I said ok, mistakes happen, please give us the rooms at the stated rate. Only one was available, and she would not give us the rate my online booking was. We booked that room, plus 3 singles since they did not have double bed rooms. It was 2:30 and we were told to come back at 3 since the rooms needed to be cleaned. We came back at 4 pm and 2 rooms were not ready! I mentioned this and the reply was "Well at least we have some of the rooms." I really do not recommend this hotel. There are so many nicer options in the immediate area with similar pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl1066ha
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal for a wedding-The hotel personel were very nice and accomidating a little kurt on the night we arrived but really just fine. The first night we stayed we found 3 bugs on our bed. I looked for other signs of bedbugs but did not see any. I called front desk and did not have a reply. I e-mailed hotel to explain the situation and was told that they were mostly likely baby mosquitos from an open window! 1) you can't open your window from the 12th floor and we didn't. 2) THEY WERE NOT BABY MOSQUITOS!! I felt like they really were not concerned afterall I had already paid my $505.00 bill for 2 nights. The Maitre D at the resturant we very nice Mangala she made every attempt to assure our stay was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnGMorpeth
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been refurbished and large rooms are comfortable. Hotel is well positioned for exploring Montreal with many restaurants, shops within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel in a modern city”
Reviews.Author: SagaLEB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel at the beginning of June 2011. From a genera perspective this is an old hotel but its negativities are balanced by its location in the heart of a city's vibrant downtown. I can write a review on the following points: 1- Hotel in General The building is a huge one with large stories. Entrance is a little narrow with a small lobby and a small reception. It is expected from a 4 stars but can be refurbished to showcase a more luxurious environment. The reception is small with only two counters. Elevators are also old leading to old style corridors at each floor. 2- Rooms I was able to get a huge room as I was offered a two queen room, knowing that I was solo. It was a last minute booking and got it on time. Rooms need some serious refurbishment. Extremely old school and sometimes lack the finesse you would find in a 4 star chain. I was surprised to see an analogue AC control at the door, cable hiders running over the door, and an old style TV. The window was very small and it overlooked a residential building, so close that I was actually watching their TV. The toilets are outdated, strange distribution, they have a style which was hip back in the 60s. I was surprised to heart the loud bang of crunching pipes when my neighbor used his faucets. Everything in this hotel needs to be redone. 3- Staff Well here's where the good characteristics start showing. I would definitely give a 5 stars for the staff, their helpfulness, and talkative manner. I was greeted with the best respect ever and was explained everything I needed to know to have access to all amenities of my stay. They know exactly what to tell you. Housekeeping, room service all promote the same respectful and courteous manners which you expect from the finest chains. My compliments go to two receptionists who were really good at making me fee at home while I was checking in at 1 in the morning. 4- Location The hotel is located on Sherbrook door to door with McGill university. It is two blocks away from St. Catherines street and a block from Peel Metro station. It is located literally at the heart of all the action and offers access to the best activities in downtown Montreal. That's another 5 stars I would recommend this hotel for short stays of 2 to 3 days, everything other than that you can get better quality across the street at Omni for the same 200 dollars or just across at the Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it!”
Reviews.Author: helen196752
Reviews.Content: Working for an law firm as an interpreter, I often have to travel in Canada and abroad. When I recently visited Montreal on a business-related trip, I was pleasantly surprised by the excellent service provided to me at the reception of the hotel. The staff was amazingly knowledgeable and could answer all the questions I asked them re: shopping, attractions, restaurants, etc. The location of the hotel was absolutely perfect and a fridge in the room was another bonus. I think it's a bargain for the price you pay and will certainly stay there if I have to go to Montreal again. Maria S.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing 'best' about this 'western'”
Reviews.Author: Caedon15
Reviews.Content: Pros: Front desk staff friendly (although we only interacted with them minimally) Centrally located near downtown shopping and restaurants Comfortable beds Free wireless Cons: Tube tv- not very many channels Cheap, ineffective toiletries (my hair was not clean after using their products) Strange room layout - the bed was almost fully blocking acess to the small tale and chairs in the back of the room. Dingy - old decor, wallpaper, bathrooms, gross carpet, etc. The hotel room doors were interior door quality and strength, not the exterior door strength they should be. No continental breakfast Plastic hanging bar in closet that had trouble even holding the weight of a few suits Did I mention it was dingy? Expensive - you are definitely not getting what you pay for. We did not visit the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Was this a bait & switch?”
Reviews.Author: Dusty92
Reviews.Content: After 8 days of traveling in Canada and getting very lost finding this hotel, we checked in tired and hungry. The gentleman who checked us in, commented that we'd gotten a good price on our room. We checked into this 3 star hotel, hurried to find some food (only coffee shop on site), came back and went to sleep. We awoke to see mold and dirt painted over on the ceiling, a 'log' type board against the bathroom entrance (it was a step up) and was not doing its job. The bed itself was dusty and the room appeared little used. The bathroom floor was very dirty and we found hair on the bthroom counter and some red stuff in the sink; glass table tops were chipped, . When we checked out, I discussed this with the supervisor at the front desk. He listen with a bit of a smile on his face and with insincere comments. He asked why we didn't report it immediately, I asked him why he chose to put us in a one star room. There was much more conversation and in the end, he handed me a copy of my bill and said goodbye. In brief, I believe because we got a good online price (we booked several months in advance), we were given a converted closet quickly set up as a room in a back corner of the hotel. I do not recommend this hotel--I believe this was a bait and switch (this was a Holiday day weekend) so they could sell a 3 star room to someone else for top dollar and I am also questioning my loyalty to Best Western Hotels. This is the most haughty, thoughtless and inconsiderate experience I've ever encountered and I regret going to this hotel. The advertising is not accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location but in need of substantial updating...”
Reviews.Author: Bozzie63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights over the Grand Prix weekend (6/10-6/13/11). It was our first experience with this hotel. We understood it wasn't a 4-5 star place so our expectations were level-set ahead of time. Overall, we found the staff very pleasant, professional and capable. We also picked this hotel due to its location...in the heart of Montreal. Given that getting any hotel room over this busy weekend, we felt that the $289/night cost acceptable. We would not pay this amount over regular weekends. We felt that the hotel needed some serious updating. There is a large section of plywood covering the roof of the cafe in front of the hotel. The windows don't open more than 2 inches...probably because we were on the 3rd floor (#309) and the hotel must have experienced some problems with drunken customers. Anyway, the bathroom was very low rent...actually had the large light plastic cover fall and hit my wife on the head. Luckily, she wasn't really hurt but startled to say the least. There was also a loud banging noise 2 of the 3 nights that woke us up. I notified the staff and it didn't occur on the last night. The furniture was dated and relatively clean. There is no safe in the room. They do have a safe deposit box located at the front desk but we opted to not use it. The onsight restaurant has a Lebanese cuisine for the most part. The cost of liquor is very high...perhaps due to the weekend. They do have a breakfast buffet...$15 per person. Not a great amount of items to select but it was ok for us. We did valet our car for $25/day. No problems there. Overall, we'd probably stay somewhere else for next year's Grand Prix if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities OK, rooms not”
Reviews.Author: debat144
Reviews.Content: We were booked here by Velo Quebec for the Montreal Bike Fest - no bargain, BTW. I will book a hotel myself next year. As would be expected for a Velo-Quebec "4-star" hotel, there was a fitness room and a restaurant. There was also a free breakfast, which was very pleasant. The restaurant was unimpressive, especially for the neighborhood, which is right next to McGill U. Some people have reviewed the reception staff negatively, but we didn't have any problems. Didn't try the fitness facility, as we were there to bike. The room left a lot to be desired. We were on the 18th floor - I don't know if this is relevant to the quality. On the positive side, it was clean, the queen bed was comfy, and there was free wireless. On the negative side; everything was very small - the room, the bathroom, the tiny table, everything. The furnishings were worn and to my eyes, ugly. The sink was chipped, the plumbing was noisy, and it was hard to start the shower without banging into the towel rack. There was no desk. There were several other nit-picky annoying things, not worth listing but which affected the stay. We knew we would have to pay for parking. It was $25 per night, for a total of $75 for three nights, more expensive than we expected. We are not demanding travelers, but I thought this hotel left much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: jeanpereira
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel, probably not the best in Montreal, but good enough to spend a few days in this splendid city. It could use a improvement in its furniture, felt a little old watching a cathodic TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and value”
Reviews.Author: jlgoss50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Western for two nights in April. The service was exceptional. The rooms are relatively small but very clean. Wireless internet works fine. Great value for the money and very close to everything. We would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and noisy, if you want sleep don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: FV1155032
Reviews.Content: We went to Montrhe Jazz fest and had the worst nights sleep because the staff can't control the loud guests at this hotel. I complained, but the noise continued all night. If you want to sleep, don't visit this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: warwick555
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pleasant. The staff was very polite and professional. Our room was always cleaned when we came back and they were generous with the supplies. The Lebanese restaurant there was fantastic. The parking was expensive - 25 per day. There may be cheaper 24 deals nearby so check. Also, their ads show a fireplace lit up in their cozy sitting room off the lobby. However, when we asked them to light it, they said it hadn't worked for months. Otherwise, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great service”
Reviews.Author: FrancoD88
Reviews.Content: I was here with a group of University students recently and really liked my room! The services were quite good and they worked very fast, and most importantly they were relaxed, checking in 200 students. The entire lobby was full of students and their luggage. We waited about 30 minutes to get to the front of the line and it only took about 3 minutes to get checked in and on our way. That was great. The lobby area was small and I found the entrance way slightly cheesy. They could have arranged the room better, but the main desk to the left, after the 4-5 stairs, was nice. Some more grand hotels in the area have a nicer layout to the lobby, but once I arrived in my room, it was very clean and had a nice pleasant smell, comfortable and fresh sheets, new soaps, shampoos, shoe polish and anything I could possibly need. I would definitely come back. I only used this room to sleep. Did not order food or eat here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel, Odors and Floods”
Reviews.Author: BizTrav11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in February 2011. Although the staff are friendly, the hotel itself is old and in bad need of updating. I was entering the room they assigned my and was overwhelmed by the strong odor of sanitizer. Asking to be moved, the next room had a moldy, musty odor (probably what the deodorizer was trying to cover). I finally accepted a third room mostly because I was exhausted and did not want to look for an alternate at 10:00 at night. The room was dated and tired. Endless coats of old paint and a bathroom that looked like it was from the 50s. The next day I was at a conference all day and night, returning late. I could not get any service in the hotel bar. It seems the staff we're conjugated at the back while I waited. So I went to bed. My early morning visit to the washroom resulted in the ancient toilet overflowing an flooding the room. So I had to prepare for my day amidst a maintenance man sucking up the water with a very loud wet vac. I think this hotel is only still in business due to it's location. There many great hotels, however, in the immediate area (Sofitel, Omni). Stat at those and avoid the Best Western Ville Marie!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Anne_L_Rome
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Best Western Ville Marie on various occasions, both as a business traveller and for leisure. The overall service is excellent, the staff is friendly and the location is central. I am very pleased to be a repeat customer and I look forward to my next stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to any travellers visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome trip”
Reviews.Author: Robert7789
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the best western on my last trip to montreal and i have to say that it was awsome. The staff is lovelly, when i had question about anything the people at the frontdesk were able to give me good indication so i know the good spot for bars, restaurants or anything else. On the last day of my trip i had probleme in the computer room to print my bording pass and i went to the frontdesk for someone to help me with the computer but Jeremy at the frontdesk just printed them on he's computer and everything was settle in 2 min. Thank you everyone for making my stay so good and next time i'll be going to montreal i will go back at the best western ville marie for sure.

Reviews.Title: “INVALID ROOM CHARGES - Charged $2,200+”
Reviews.Author: Taistealgobrach
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 nights. Checked in On Thursday evening and out on Sat. morning. I was contacted by a rude manager (Salem Tohmy) late Monday afternoon. He told me that he was going (but had already charged prior to the call) to charge my credit card $2,200+ for damages to our room. He stated that we had a party in the room and after I told him that we didn't he then said that we burnt the carpet causing $2k+ worth of damages. I asked him why it took so long to call me or to check the room he said that he didn't work weekends (no other manager working weekends?). We did not cause any damage what so ever to this dingy hotel room. There was no smoking or partying in our room. I am currently disputing the charges with my credit card company. THANK YOU WORST WESTERN FOR ALL THE UNNECESSARY HASSEL .....WHAT A SCAM

Reviews.Title: “it was good, but could've been better”
Reviews.Author: leyla00
Reviews.Content: The staff were nice and knowledgeable about Cetre Ville. Valet parking is included in the price, but no breakfast . The location was amazing, close to everything in downtown. The bathroom and the room were clean, but the room was small.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingman665
Reviews.Content: By far the best customer service I have ever had. Clean and comfortable, knowledgeable and friendly staff and perfectly located to downtown and steps to the bell centre. Could not have asked for a better experience. To top it all off I had an issue that I left some funds in the room and only realized it upon my return home from the trip. A single email to the hotel and with in 7 days I had a certified cheque waiting for me at my desk at work. Rafik truly went above and beyond what was necessary and I will be staying at this location for all future trips to Montreal. Thanks again for such a memorable trip.!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: n0rwegianw00d
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel has been getting a bad rep lately! I was generally satisfied with my stay, but I did feel that the staff at the front desk could have been a little friendlier. I kind of felt like I was bothering them every time I had a request. The room was fine in appearance and cleanliness, but I must agree with some of the previous commenters about a faint smell of smoke (even though it was a non-smoking room). Big pro, though: Internet use is free, which was not the case at the previous hotel we stayed with. As I said, I am generally satisfied, but I think I might try a different hotel next time I'm in Montreal. OK service - OK room - OK bed.

Reviews.Title: “DonÂ´t stay at this hotel. They donÂ´t live up to the 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: Ravn2000
Reviews.Content: We stay in 2 star motel where the rooms where more nice. Problem whit water presure and noise from the elevators. Even after getting a new room, no change! So find a other hotel in Montreal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Susan46051
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find, in the center of everything, within walking distance of many of the city's best features-museums, Bell Center, the underground mall, good restaurants. Yet, it was quiet, being near Mont Royal, with a view of the park from our hotel window. The valet service for parking our car was quick and so was check-in. The room was quiet, clean and the beds very comfortable. The concierge was very helpful in directing us to several choices of restaurants tailored to our needs and directions to the Bell Center where we would be taking in a show later that evening. We would definitely stay again and recommend it to others. Check-in and check-out times were reasonable. The price was in range of what this type of hotel runs, but we will keep a look out for better rates, perhaps when it is not in prime season.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service - Prepare to be treated disrespectfully”
Reviews.Author: RichM99
Reviews.Content: On July 31st, myself and a friend traveled to Montreal for the Osheaga festival. We had parked the car on the hill in a nice location to the hotel, and came in to see if we could check in early. The room wasn't yet available. That was fine. The front desk manager asked us if we came by car and we had. He told us to drive the car around and they would park it for us. We mentioned we had it already parked, and he said there was hotel parking we just needed to leave it with Bell staff. So we did. At no point in time was it mentioned that there was a fee of $25 for this. The car had already been parked and it was within a block of the hotel. We should have been informed of the charge. As we were with the front desk manager, we asked if they wanted us to take in our luggage or if we should leave it with the car. We were told that leaving it in the car was fine. We let them know that we would be checking in around 1 am, as we had to get to the concert. We were told that was fine, and again if we wanted to leave our luggage in the car, that was fine to do so since we had access to our car at any time. So we handed the car over to the valet and left the luggage in the car. When we got back at 1am, we waited for the bell staff as I was told earlier in the day, to give him my ticket and get the car for the luggage as my friend went to check us in. The front desk manager told me to come up and not to wait for the bell staff. We assumed he would be getting the bell staff for us. He started to check us in when the phone rang. He then started began a 10 minute long tirade about another staff member not completing his work correctly. Meanwhile we waited; at no time did he let the person on the line know he had CUSTOMERS waiting to be checked in. At the end of the call he didn't apologize to us for the wait. As a customer, the last thing I want is to wait while the front desk manager complains about his job. He then got off the phone and another call came in, he picked it up and took the call, this time from another customer calling from their room. We waited again. But this time we mentioned to him, that we were customers and that he should finish serving us before serving another customer. We had expected him to pick it up and ask the person to please hold while he finished attending to our check in. He then proceeded to argue with us, letting us know that we were not priority as we were checking in. He didn't apologize, but was rude and held no respect for the customers in front of him. We asked him when he was going to ring for the bell staff so we can get our car. He told us we had to get the bell staff ourselves. We made mention that the service was lacking and we would address the issue in the morning. He didn't care and told us to "do whatever we wanted". When we went to give our ticket to the Bell staffer, he asked me rather rudely why we didn't leave our luggage behind. I said we were told we could leave it in the car and we had access to it any time of day. He then corrected me and said I should have left it behind. I told him that we were not told this earlier. He very begrudgingly went to get our car. In the morning when we went to check out, we let the morning front manager know what had happened the night before. He said he would speak to the staff member. So we checked out gave our car ticket to the bell staff. We were in our car about to drive away when a bell staff member knocked on our window, and started asking aggressively why we didn't tip them, he FRIGHTENED us, we were two women in the car, and he was an aggressive Male we gave him $5, but didnâ€™t really feel we should have. First of all, we paid $25 for parking that we hadn't expected to pay and assumed as with most places gratuities were included. Second, it is NEVER acceptable to demand a gratuity - it is at our discretion if and when we give one. After we left, we felt awful, frustrated and annoyed at how the staff members treated us. At each customer contact point the hotel failed. We were guests at this hotel. We were charged without being told of a fee, we were treated with no respected from the night manager and the bell staff.

Reviews.Title: “I would've rather slept on the street”
Reviews.Author: JulieMarie21
Reviews.Content: Well, let me start from the beginning... When we arrived at the hotel we thought there would have been underground parking and turned into the alleyway behind the hotel, instead of Best Western parking, there was McGill parking. Along with this nice gift was the horrid stench of disgustingness, not even just garbage it was absolutely disgusting and the smell stayed in my car for about 10 minutes. We turned around and went back on the street and finally saw the Valet Parking sign in front of the building, so to our lovely surprise we realized that we had no choice but to use this "Valet Parking" service. After we parked in front of the building we stood for a few minutes but the stench from the alleyway had drifted to the front so we decided to check in before we died. I waited outside for the guy to come "valet park" my car and waited about 15 minutes until he finally came to me and said are you ready? Of course i was ready i had been waiting 15 minutes, since there was only one valet parking attendant working on this busy saturday. When we went inside to his "valet" booth he asked for the ticket, which we did not have because the really smart employee at the front desk failed to ask my boyfriend if he would be using the "valet parking" service. So we had to wait even longer for him to go get the ticket. Before the valet guy got in my car he asked "is that all?" We had no idea what he was talking about and assumed he wanted a tip which he clearly didn't deserve. Then he sped away with unnecessary speed. (The "Valet Parking" ended up costing 28 $ without the tip, what a waste of money) When we finally made it to the 16th floor using the elevator that looked like it was wrapped in tin foil, we went to our friends room first and when they opened the door the first thing that came to my mind was "This is so weird". Their room was very oddly shaped, there was a hall type thing that led to the bed, the lighting was very dull, same with the wallpaper, and it made me feel very depressed. We discussed this and we all felt the exact same way. The bathroom was not very nice and the windows were complete crap, they didn't even slide properly and would get stuck when we opened them. After seeing my friends' room i was pretty scared to see what our room would look like. Well it was completely different. It was very small and there was a king size bed in it that took up almost the entire room, so there was barely any room to walk around. Our bathroom wasn't nice either and the shower was pretty much made of plastic. The bed was okay in comfort. Which is really the only good thing i can say about this hotel. Both rooms were fairly old fashioned and slightly hideous. The "valet parking" guy had given us a slip to identify our car and on the bottom was a number you were supposed to call when you wanted your car. A few minutes before we were going to check out my boyfriend tried to call the number and it was not in service. So after checking out we had to wait again for our car. And the new "valet guy" forgot to give me my car keys and went back inside with them so i had to go ask him for them. Overall I REALLY disliked this hotel and i have no idea how it got a 3 star rating on this site, let alone a sign on the outside of the hotel that says 4 stars. WHAT A JOKE. I will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service at this hotel -- there's a joke.”
Reviews.Author: CreamyNutOolong
Reviews.Content: I had the occasion to stay at the Best Western Ville-Marie during a recent trip to Montreal for the Jazz Festival. My husband and I shared a room with two friends, and, up until after we checked out, everything was great. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, and when we asked for additional towels (there were only three for four people), they were provided. After checking out, I realized that we had forgotten some items in the closet in the room, and we returned to the hotel after we left the Jazz Festival and on our way home. When I asked the evening staff if I could retrieve my items, I was rudely advised that their policy was that only the executive housekeeper can access the Lost and Found, that this person was not available, and that Lost and Found had closed for the day. Upon asking why this was their policy, I was subjected to a lengthy monologue about it being ridiculous for me to anticipate that I would be able to retrieve lost items at any time of day. I was then advised with a sneer that they could send me my items by Purolator, but that I would have to cover the cost. I found this unacceptable, given that I was standing in front of the desk staff at the time. It makes little sense that I would be required to pay for shipping when they were unable to simply retrieve the items when I was there in person. My husband and I escalated our request to have shipping fees waived in light of the situation to the Director, Salem Tohme. He refused to return three messages left by my husband, instead referring the call to a "coordinator" who simply emailed my husband their shipping rates and a form for us to fill out with credit card information (which was already on file as I used mine to pay for the room) in order for them to ship the items. It was only when I left a long and detailed message that I received a phone call from the Director, who advised me very rudely that "well, it is your choice, ma'am" if I chose not to stay there again. It was obvious that the Director deemed our concerns to be a waste of his time. At a different hotel in Montreal, my husband left his cellphone charger in our room, and said hotel shipped it to us at no cost, no questions asked. I have to wonder where the Best Western Ville-Marie gets its customer service training. Clearly, I do not intend to stay at this hotel again. I am appalled by the exceedingly poor customer service skills employed by staff, and have a hard time believing that a complete overhaul of staff has not been done, given the other negative reviews of staff posted on TripAdvisor by other patrons.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel to stay at if you are new to Montreal, or anytime!”
Reviews.Author: angie3278
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Montreal. The location was perfect. Walking distance to all the shops, pubs and the Metro. A small convenience store just 2 mins away, you can buy beer, wine - they'll even open the wine for you there. At the hotel there were 2 valet/bellmen that knew everything, Greg and William, they were so friendly and had information at the drop of a hat for us. We didn't have to worry about taking the wrong Metro line, or bus or going down the wrong street. They knew the best times to go places and how to get there. They made our stay at the hotel and in Montreal excellent. By the end of the week we were talking like friends discussing our days. Only the breakfast buffet was very exspensive. $15, which for me who doesn't eat a big breakfast was way too much. I only had a bagle...for $15! But there is also a little cafe with muffins and nice breads, coffee, etc.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is just ok....”
Reviews.Author: Caledon_lass
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming feature of this hotel is its location and the reception people where also very nice. That said, it was a bit stressful to get into my room and then find that there was only a "trickle" of water coming out of the tap. And absolutely no hot water. I left the tap on in the hopes that it would improve over time, it did not....It was at 11 pm, so I would not think that there were a lot of people using water at that time that would have caused the water flow to be so poor. In the morning, dreading what the shower was going to be like, there was water, but it took a full 10 minutes before there was any hot water! The rooms are basic. Relatively clean, there was an odd stain on one of the pillows...didn't want to investigate that too closely.... I got the room at a corporate rate, but even then it was pricey. I guess what you are paying for is location.....

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous cleaning charge, extremely rude manager”
Reviews.Author: janebobane
Reviews.Content: The stay itself was pleasant enough but was sullied by the $300 surcharge we discovered on the following month's credit card statement. Upon questioning, we were told that it was a "deep cleaning surcharge" and we would need to speak with the manager Salem Tohm to resolve the issue. After a week of ignored phone calls and emails we finally speak with him and are told that that charge was due to "brown paper garbage and some beer bottles". There was no damage whatsoever and Salem was unnecessarily rude. He claimed that he needed to call in extra cleaning staff to throw out the six or so bottles that we left on the countertops. Best Western head office is now dealing with our issue and seemed just as taken aback by the charge as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: nikaPoa
Reviews.Content: Very simple but cozy and nice hotel. The rooms were very big, clean and the bed was very confortable. The staff was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dudleyToronto
Reviews.Content: First off, there is no parking at the hotel. You need to have a valet get your car every time you need it. (and of course they charge you for that.) Beds are comfortable but the TV doesn't work and the furniture is old and decrepit. Large yellow stains on the ceiling from who knows what. Very noisy as well from the street. We booked for three nights and checked out after two and they still charged me for the third night even thoough I let them know long before the check-in time for the third night. which I thought was extremely unfair. I go to Montreal on a regular basis and it is the first time I stayed there and it will be the last. I will go back to the Lord Berri.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Toronto7_Traveller70
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Montreal on business - hotel is in a great location - Downtown Montreal. Room was comfortable and clean but what really made my stay was the service received by staff members. The concierge was superb - remembered me every morning and when I would return back to the hotel in the afternoon - he would remember where I was going in the morning and made it conversation. Front Desk very friendly. Even the General Manager greeted me in the morning while in the lobby waiting for a taxi. They have a great restaurant - if you like Meditteranean food - it's a must to try but really liked the cafe attached to the hotel - nice spot to have a coffee and do some work (wireless internet available). Overall - great experience for the price I paid - I will definetely be returning back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel for business, maybe ok for leisure”
Reviews.Author: lexlimo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one big deal breaker if you are on business. They have a bizarre, arcane limit of 100MB of data traffic over wireless in any 24 hour period. If you go over (and I'm not sure how I did just working on my work wiki) they can't reset it, your MAC address is blocked. Supposedly just for 24 hours but mine never came back on, I was locked out of wireless with work to do. There isn't even an option to pay for more bandwidth, the hotel has no control over this system. If you are in town on business find a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: junebug1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but it was almost $200 per night for a standard room and they charge you $25 per night for parking. There are only 2 elevators and they won't let you use the stairs. We got in after the big UFC fight and it took us 30 mins to get an elevator...the line was crazy.

Reviews.Title: “No-nonsense hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Waterloon
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of location (right next to McGill University where I was visiting) and price. At $100Cdn per night it was significantly cheaper than even the McGill corporate rates at other hotels near by. This hotel is a decent clean hotel with modest amenities. Rooms are smallish and darkish but the beds are comfortable and the toilet works. Be aware that there is only valet parking at $25 per night. Only complaint was no real available electrical plugs -- had to unplug lamps to work the computer. Also, the free WiFi download is limited to 100MB per day -- enough for updating email but if you have teenagers with YouTube addictions, forget it. It's location is great for visiting McGill or walking to the main drags of St. Catherines street or Crescent Street for shopping or bars. The old city or St. Laurent is a bit of a hike but there is a great Metro system. This would be one of my first choices when looking for a room in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: vanessy
Reviews.Content: Worst experience of my life! I was threatened, mocked and treated badly by rude staff. Rooms were old fashioned. My experience was so bad that it forced me to call 911 after feeling very insecure after staff broke into my room. Manager Salem tohme is the most unreasonable man...and needs some customer service classes. Almost charged $100 for crushed popcorn on the floor until I decided to take on housekeeping job and vacumn the floor they said would take 45 minutes. Good location though. Would NEVER EVER reccomend to stay here uless you like unprofessional staff and haunting memories. Ruined my New years!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JohnLeduc_Alberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western Ville Marie Hotel for six days. We had information about the Hotel from the AAA travel book. The Hotel is in an excellent location in the downtown area. It is within walking distance to numerous restaurants and entertainment areas. It is also within a block of a Metro station. Check -in and check-out went very smoothly because of a very courteous,friendly and efficient staff. During the course of our stay we encountered a problem with the cleaning staff. The problem was dealt with quickly to our satisfaction. The concierge staff was extremely helpful even though they were very busy at peak times.The room was spacious and the bathroom had above average amenities. The bed was very comfortable and had white duvet covers. While at the Hotel we needed access to a computer. We were allowed to use a computer with internet connections which was located in a private business centre room. We were most impressed with the Hotel and recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Start of a great tour”
Reviews.Author: lukester28
Reviews.Content: Currently in the midst of our North American vacation and having such a lovely time that we thought we would start writing about our journeys. One of the stops on our tour was the Ville Marie which is part of the Best Western chain. We were not too familiar with this franchise as they are not too large where we are from, but we had to admit that it was simply a charming property with an abundance of European influence. As it was our first time in Montreal we were ever so grateful for the aide which the staff provided. The location was quite handy for us to walk everywhere and the maps made available to us by the staff were most helpful. There was a restaurant in the hotel, however we only used it for breakfast, and we chose to have our dinners in the city and experience the local culture. Again, the service of the hotel was most kind to recommend places to dine. As we spent most of our time touring, we did not spend much time in the room, but can assure you that they were clean, comfortable and quite affordable. The Ville Marie certainly started our trip on the right foot.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...could do better”
Reviews.Author: Jinca
Reviews.Content: In a word, i would give this hotel an "Eh"...the location is unbeatable however. Located just north of Rue St. Catherine, this hotel is far enough away to not have millions of people around all the time, but close enough to everything to feel like you're in the thick of it. Close to a metro, dining, shops, and museums this location couldn't be better. Unfortunately however, the conditions were sub par. The Room was fairly clean but the bedding situation was unusual. There were no sheets on the bed, they expect you to use the spread (dirty) to sleep on. There was only one pillow on the bed and after searching found the other in a bag in the closet. The shower was the best part of the room and offered great pressure and temp control. I read other reviews of this hotel before booking and people were complaining of the air conditioning situation...or lack thereof, which is entirely true. The room on a hot summer day was muggy and not comfy to sleep in and the air conditioning didn't work at all. All in all, if you don't expect much from a one night stay or a similar circumstance then this is a fine place to stay, otherwise i would search for other options.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: GuelphMarlene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and I have to say it was horrible.They made us pay for a movie we didn't see, the room was dirty and in desperate need of a renovation and when we ordered room service it took 45 minutes to come.When I talked to the manager about our problems he basicly ignored me put it down to my being a woman.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western - Best Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: thanner
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at the Best Western in Montreal for the Jazz Festival. The hotel was very nice, great comfortable beds, large rooms. The location of the hotel is also great, right downtown near some great shopping. However, the best part of the stay was the AMAZING service provided by our concierge - Rami. I have been to Montreal often and have stayed at a lot of different hotels, but this is the first one where the concierge has gone out of his way to make sure our visit to Montreal was truly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: IanG001
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days. Location of Hotel is good, easy to get to other parts of the city. Room was OK, but in need of decoration. Staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: heymaybe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Ville-Marie for three nights in the middle of April. The staff was incredibly helpful through my entire stay. My room was incredibly large and always kept clean. The free internet room downstairs was great! Traveling alone and without a laptop, I was able to keep connected with my friends and family back home. Although there were only two computers, there was never a wait, and I often had the entire room to myself. The location was excellent - very close to the Metro and right next door to McGill University. Plus, all of downtown is within walking distance. The only problem I had was that my room key-card kept deprogramming, but within minutes each time, I had a had a new card (with many apologies from the desk clerks, although it wasn't their fault!) When I checked out, they called a cab for me, and wished me on my way. I will definitely be staying here if I find myself in Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: HHJMEB
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Best Western Montreal several times during our 6 month stay in Canada. The Staff are very friendly and helpful, rooms are large, beds are comfortable and rooms are clean and tidy. It is a very comfortable, well located, value for money hotel in downtown Montreal. If you are looking for 5 star luxury then this is not for you. If you are looking for value for money this is EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “Freindly atmoshphere”
Reviews.Author: DEN1
Reviews.Content: Our family stays at the hotel every summer and find the staff excellent, and you get the feeling of a homey atmoshphere. I would tell anyone to stay here its so close to everything. The rooms are comfortable, pillows can be better. Overall a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the TV system”
Reviews.Author: antemora
Reviews.Content: The TV system in this hotel is confusing, to say the least. You can be put in the position to pay for a movie you didn't watch if you are not VERY careful. The hotel employs an outside company to run its TV system and they don't help customers in trying to get money refunded for services not received.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointed - poor quality motel - never mind a four star”
Reviews.Author: edhamo
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE HOTEL!!!! NEEDS to be renovated really bad! DEFENITELY not a four star as advertised.. I WOULD really have to complain ... Staff is nice but worthless after horrible rooms/ pastic tiles and tab and the oldest elevator I have been since eastern europe. I am not a picky person but paying 135 dollars a night you would think you stay somewhere decent. TRUST ME.. do not stay in that hotel.. lots others to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay but not great”
Reviews.Author: Wildlilac
Reviews.Content: Considering the price that we paid for a double room, it should've been a nicer double room. I felt ripped off. The room was semi clean - the sheets were not pulled tightly and the pillows were flat! The ventilation fan in the bathroom was loud and there were cracks on the wall. The water in the bathtub did not drained properly (it took a while to drained). Some of the great things were ironing board and wireless access in the room, and there is a gym on the third floor. There is a Lebanese restaurant on the ground floor and a cafe. Sure the location was great but there are plenty of hotels around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Costs but Super Service”
Reviews.Author: BET2WIN
Reviews.Content: I called many hotels to get Rates and Discounts, and none stood out like the Guy on the phone here. I had already read about Rami and Peter bending over backwards to help out people in a prior review. Well that name stuck in my head and when I heared that same person on the phone with the caring and will to help and a genuine â€œwe want you to stay with us.â€� It was something really surprising for North American standards. Well Rami convinced me to book at this hotel for location and service and gave me a great rate with the AAA membership. When I called back at 12pm when we got to Montreal it was their colleague Julie who said that she could put aside a great room for us(as we were already going to be charged anyway) and she didnâ€™t let us down, even though we only checked in at 4pm that great room on the 18th floor with a view on of the mountain was on hold for us. Now let me tell you about check in. It was Peter saying "anything you want sir we are at your service". He looked at me and suggested clubs and VIP line bypass and gave us a rundown of the events in Montreal that weekend. From the Firework competition to the Comedy Festival and even restaurants and getting around the city on their METRO. I am 32 and I come in from Toronto with my Mom to visit my sister and some friends I had met in Cuba over the last year. So it was different things that we wanted to do, but they were upto the task and we had a great time. Now this was the only bigger hotel that acted like the small Bed &Breakfasts where the owners tell you where to go and what to do. In the larger Hoity Toity joints I would have probably got a great cooperate rate but I have never liked dealing with the snotty Concierges, who make you feel like they are opening the gates of heaven to me by giving you confidential info. The only drawbacks were just the added cost of $10/night if you wanted a mini fridge brought to the room and 88cents+12cents(tax) so that was ONE DOLLAR PER LOCAL CALL. This is ok if you make just a couple of calls but my sister and many friends are Montrealâ€™s soo that added up like a drink bill on a cruise ship. Then the only other thing was that if you wanted a room with 2 double beds it was 8 bucks more even if you didnâ€™t have any more than 2 people staying in the room. So now you are probably saying this is nothing just a bit more but â€“ it can add up very quickly and mean about $40 more at checkout. This is something that I wouldnâ€™t see at any other 4star hotel but this is what makes me think of this place as a Best Western. Only annoying thing â€“ Getting ICE â€“ 19floors â€“ but ice machines only on 4 floors. That means if you want a COLD drink at any given time you more than likely will have to take an elevator to get some ice. But I will still be back at this hotel, why? STAFF, LOCATION and SERVICE I will just bring up a cooler and tell everyone to call me or bring my voice over IP with laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Canada, my husband and I took a train to Montreal. What a wonderful city! We stayed at the Best Western Ville Marie right in downtown and were very pleased with our choice. The price was reasonable and the hotel will provide you with free internet access if you have a laptop (The technical support was superb in helping me establish a connection). The hotel is right in the middle of everything and everything else is within walking distance. We had a fabulous time in Montreal and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and found very nice. The price was reasonable and the service was great. The front desk and conceirge staff were extremly helpfull. I would definetly recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Montreal - Wonderful Staff -- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OVERALL: We stayed here in August 2005, about the same time as the previous reviewers. We booked somewhat in advance and did not have any issues getting a non-smoking room. Our room was clean and there were no maintenance problems. The lobby of this hotel is very nice, although it was a little more spread out / strangely configured than most hotel lobbies. The lobby had a very nice chandelier and fountain. There is a valet / concierge when you enter. It is definitely much nicer than your typical Best Western. -------------------------------- WHAT WE LIKED: The staff!!! The two staff, Peter and Rami were outstanding!!!! They bent over backwards to discuss sightseeing ideas, restaurants, directions and to make reservations for us. They were INCREDIBLY friendly and helpful. I received the type of service from them that I would expect at a five star hotel like the Ritz Carlton. The location was great! It is located a couple of blocks from the Metro, it was very close to the top restaurants in the city and to the beginning of the shopping area. Since it was centrally located, a lot of the places we went were walkable to us (e.g., the old city), although some people who don't like walking may think otherwise. There was a very nice Lebanese restaurant adjoining the hotel as well as a cafÃ©. The restaurant seemed a lot nicer than restaurants in other hotels of this price range. For what you received, you couldn't beat the price in Montreal. Just book far enough in advance with the understanding that depending on who/where you book it from, the price will vary dramatically -- you have to bargain hunt for discounts. We paid less than $125 / night. ----------------------- WHAT WE DIDN'T LIKE: During our stay, we happened to be across the street from the Omni hotel staff strike. Our room/window was facing the Omni Hotel. With that in mind, they were playing loud music and screaming through megaphones. Although they didn't picket late at night or real early in the morning, it was early enough to be our wake-up call. NOTE: This is not the hotel's fault and there is nothing they could do about this.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: freq_flyer08
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel we have ever stayed at. My friends and I had an exciting weekend planned in downtown Montreal. We had originally booked a non-smoking room. I guaranteed it using my credit card. When we arrived at the hotel, which was at about 2:30 am, we found out there were no non-smoking rooms available. The person at the desk told me that I did not reserve a non-smoking room. He then blatantly lied to me that he checked the reservation system. Because when I called Best Western, they checked and it clearly said NON-SMOKING. Anyways we had to settle for a smoking suite. We soon realized that the suite had a leaking ceiling. They told us they would work on the ceiling. In addition, the room was extremely musti and one of my friends had an asthma condition. Because of the smoke, she was not in the best shape. They then promised us another room. They explicitly told us that we could get another non-smoking room as a room had cleared up. But then when we got back to the hotel after a few hours, they said they had fixed the ceiling and that there were still no rooms available. The hotel did absolutely nothing for us. They couldn't move us to another room because the hotel was packed. For our troubles they gave us a $25 credit for the cott we used. In addition they gave us a complimentary suit cover that said Best Western. We were not impressed. We filed a complaint with the Best Western Customer Service. The general manager replied that there was nothing else he could do. The general manager explicitly told me "Sir we had to maximize our revenue that night." Please do not stay here. This hotel doesn't deserve squat. They do not deserve to be licensed. They do not deserve to be standing on the ground they are on. In the end, Best Western Customer Service, gave us 2 free nights by crediting us Gold Crown Points. The hotel is independently owned so they can do whatever they choose to do to their customers. Best Western Customer service was even surprised at how poorly the hotel handled the situation. The general manager is simply not a nice person and has no feelings towards his customers. These are the plain facts. Email me if you have any questions or concerns about what happened.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: anonima
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good located, the rooms are ok, the bathroom is ok. However the price per room is very expensive, I paid 370 $ for 3 nights. My problems with this hotel, started when I went into my room. I asked for a non smoking room and I found my room terrible smoked. It smelt disgusting. I asked for another room, but they couldn't change my room, because the hotel was completed that weekend. My first night was terrible. I ask the second night for new sheets and blanket, etc. They told me ok, but they didn't replaces them. On the top of all the street is very noise! I don't spend too much time in the hotel, The only thing I want is a clean room, a good bed and silent. And I didn't get it from this hotel and I spend lots of money in it.
